lead_paragraph: The Liberty Party Convention assembled in Townsend Hall, at 10 1/2 O'clock, this morning. About 100 Persons were present. The Convention was called to order by G. W. Johnson, of this city Professor Hudson, of Ohio was appointed chairman, and J. C. Hathaway, Secretary. A Committe of five, appointed for the purpose, reported the following as the permanent officers of the Convention, wao Were duly elected:
